item.title: Jennifer add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "There's folks as make bad butter and trusten to the salt t' hide it." -- George Eliot

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Never," said my aunt, "be mean in anything; never be false; never be cruel. Avoid those three vices, Trot, and I can always be hopeful of you." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Annual income twenty pounds, annual expenditure nineteen six, result happiness. Annual income twenty pounds, annual expenditure twenty pound ought and six, result misery." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Trifles make the sum of life. " -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by David Copperfield
item.description: "The most important thing in life is to stop saying 'I wish' and start saying 'I will.' Consider nothing impossible, then treat possiblities as probabilities." -- David Copperfield

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "I know enough of the world now to have almost lost the capacity of being much surprised by anything" -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "He soon felt that the fulfillment of his desires gave him only one grain of the mountain of happiness he had expected. This fulfillment showed him the eternal error men make in imagining that their happiness depends on the realization of their desires." -- Leo Tolstoy
